sponsor.partnerMessage: Bentonville is the place to be for new ideas and business. With that comes the need for more places to work, meet, and connect. This fall, Ledger is making space as a service more accessible than ever for companies of all sizes. Find out how.

posts.title: Walton Arts Center Announces 2022-23 Broadway Series
posts.content:
Last night, The Walton Arts Center pulled back the curtain and revealed the line-up for the 2022-2023 Procter & Gamble Broadway Series.

  • On the stage: This next Broadway Series will feature 6 shows all with an undercurrent of celebrating women. The shows are My Fair Lady, Pretty Woman: The Musical, Chicago, Tootsie, Moulin Rouge!, and Hadestown. 
  • Top-notch: The shows have a combined 26 Tony Awards, making 2022-23 the most awarded season to date. The WAC also announced the Arkansas debut of To Kill A Mockingbird for 2023-24. 

Learn more about the announcement and purchasing tickets HERE.

posts.title: Virtual AccelHERate Forums For Women Today
posts.content:
Are you a woman interested in starting or growing your company? Learn from women excelling in research, innovation, and business today over Zoom. 

  • Live and learn: For the 5th consecutive year, the Arkansas Small Business and Technology Development Center is hosting “accelHERate” for budding entrepreneurs. There will be 2 forums held today at 12p and 2p specifically tailored towards women in the workforce.
  • Passing it on: The forums will include lessons from businesswomen, their learned advice, and topics such as management and growth strategies, startup mistakes and how to avoid them, and key skills for entrepreneurial success. 

For more information and to register for the free event, click HERE.

posts.title: Explore Eden Highlights Exclusive Campsite @ Coler
posts.content:
Explore Eden is in the business of connecting people to the hidden outdoors. 

  • Natural beauty: Punkin Holler @ Coler is a private campsite right across the street from the world-class trails & amenities of Coler Mountain Bike Preserve. The property is perfect for exclusive camping with plenty of places to pitch a tent by natural springs, a wet-weather stream, and gorgeous trees. 
  • Stay and go: During your stay at Punkin Holler @ Coler, you can bike with ease to the Coler trails and to downtown Bentonville. Airship Coffee at Coler is nearby, and a grocery store is less than 1 mile away.

Book Punkin Holler @ Coler and other campsites like it through the Explore Eden app HERE (Google) or HERE (iOS).

posts.title: Local Coffee Shop Sending Proceeds To Family In Ukraine
posts.content:
Northwest Arkansas is constantly living up to the standards of 'others first' as its citizens show support for neighbors in the region and across the world. 

  • A friend in need: The Wicked Bean, a coffee shop in Centerton, is raising money for 2 Ukrainian regulars’ family still living in Ukraine. The regulars are loyal customers who already had a drink named after them - The Crazy Ukrainian. 
  • Sending some security: Through the month of March, the coffee shop is donating 20% of every Crazy Ukrainian purchased to their friends’ family. The money will be used for things such as medicine, gas, clothes, and food. The Wicked Bean had raised over $350 as of March 3. 

Read the full story HERE.

posts.title: Wood-Fired Pizza & Taproom Coming To Uptown Fayetteville
posts.content:
If all goes according to plan, there will be a new wood-fire pizza and taproom opening up in north Fayetteville this summer.

  • Wide variety: Smokin’ Oak Wood Fired Pizza & Taproom is known for its homemade dough and sauces, fresh veggies, and baking its pizza in a smokey wood-fired oven. The most unique part - the taproom is self-service and will bring the largest self-pour tap wall to Arkansas with a wide variety of beer, wine, and mixed drinks.
  • Community location: Located across the street from Malco Razorback Cinema in northern Fayetteville, Smokin’ Oak Wood Fired Pizza & Taproom will be in the ground floor in the shops of Uptown Apartments.

Click HERE for more details.

pick.title: NWA Daily Picks
pick.content:
• The list grows: Alice in Chains, Breaking Benjamin, and Bush are all coming to the Walmart AMP this year.
  • Spring Break: Undercroft Bar is back again in Bentonville and the theme is Tropical, based on tiki vibes.
  • In stores: Walmart is hosting an event for companies to pitch their products to be sold at Walmart.
  • Cohort: The Fayetteville Public Library is seeking applicants for its startup program.
  • W-I-N-N-E-R: A Bentonville student won the Arkansas spelling bee!
  • Work with us: Learn more about getting your business or product in the NWA Daily newsletter here.
